tweets.text:
Quagga mussels are an invasive non-native species and have recently been found in the #RiverTrent.

They can spread rapidly and block pipes.

Help us prevent this: check, clean and dry your equipment and footwear after spending time around watercourses. 
https://t.co/yvjXsvp14v https://t.co/xuYv9GXUrF

tweets.text:
River Yare flowing with diesel over XmasNY despite report to @EnvAgencyAnglia .
Now @Conservatives to relicence the neonicotinoid poisoning of bees. Not b/c sound commercial sense (it isn't), but because they can. Meanwhile they prosecute XR people. Four more years of vandalism.
Cross-party bloc of MPs back action on sewage discharge into rivers https://t.co/qq7gKCI71t

We're starting a project at the Foss Barrier in #York to replace the floodgates as part of a ¬£38m upgrade. 

When this is complete it will reduce the flood risk for around 1,200 properties in the city.

 #PrepareActSurvive @CityofYork https://t.co/dlQSWa7U53
@EnvAgencyYNE this is what is feeding into the River Loxley in #Sheffield today - I‚Äôm sick to death of reporting this to you!!!! https://t.co/XIp1UB2Dcj
Good morning #fens fans ... ü•Å

Innovative thinking | Helping endangered fish to 'climb' past the #Severn‚Äôs weirs is at the heart of a major #engineering project along the river, being carried out by @CanalRiverTrust, @severnrivers, @EnvAgency and @NaturalEngland  

Read more: https://t.co/mqbM81MIJm 

#Rivers https://t.co/A5cIW4X70o

Floods | @EnvAgency project director for the ¬£100M #Boston Barrier explains the enormous construction and installation process behind 300t flood gate, carried out by a JV between @BAMNuttall and @MottMacDonald

Watch here: https://t.co/JSPEfWQ95Q

#FloodDefences #Construction

Our plan to restore the floodplain of the lower River Otter on England‚Äôs Jurassic Coast has been approved by @eastdevon.

Work will start soon to help the valley adapt to climate change and create an internationally important wildlife reserve.

Read more: https://t.co/IrOjgPdF1f

tweets.text:
Good article @FarmersWeekly. Arbitrarily damming the River Severn affects #NorthShropshire badly. We must work with English and Welsh authorities to manage the whole river system. IDBs maintaining drains and sluices, @EnvAgency to dredge rivers.
https://t.co/LbB7crn8X0

tweets.text:
WALLEY'S QUARRY

I received a huge number of complaints about odour in the area last night and met with Councillor @SimonTagg today to discuss this.

We need to see more action on this from @EnvAgencyMids this year - please report all instances of odour to them on 0800 80 70 60. https://t.co/iQlMlIsJvu

Is this meant to be a #Brexit bonus ? Farmers to kill more wildlife #BrexitShambles 
Why? @DefraNature @DefraSoils @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @Keir_Starmer @CarolineLucas https://t.co/jINRTs3Z25

tweets.text:
In a boost to #NatureRecovery all 177 lakes (2000ha) of the #CotswoldWaterPark have being designated an #SSSI 

Allowing people and nature to thrive side by side while protecting nationally important wildlife and plants 

https://t.co/J14y6IsA3u

@EnvAgencyMids @CotswoldWaterPk https://t.co/5mulaK8X51

A very blessed solstice to the mental midget that fly-tipped this junk on our lane. Is it really too arduous to take your not-so-snazzy 80s furnishings to the dump like all thinking people do? https://t.co/UGv1Zdht29

@JamieMc76633051 @timthefruit @GeorgeMonbiot @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @HelenStace_HWT Yes, undoutedly. 

I've been a long time advocate for them going as they distort the market. Consumers should pay directly for the kind of farming they want. And where the public gains benefit from farmland without paying for it there should be a mechanism in place for that too.
@Rosewood_Farm @timthefruit @GeorgeMonbiot @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @HelenStace_HWT Would your business survive without subsidies from the taxpayer?

@JamieMc76633051 @timthefruit @GeorgeMonbiot @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @HelenStace_HWT In answer to your question, which Tim didn't actually address, you can't say they'd be unviable because farm businesses & incomes are shaped by subsidy so change would be inevitable, including changes in cropping and higher prices for consumers.
The Government know the clear harm that neonicotinoid pesticides cause to bees and other pollinators and just 3 years ago supported restrictions on them across the European Union (2/7)

A quick trip to see how our work to stabilise spoil heaps and reduce pollution has held up to #stormbella - the good news is it's looking üëå. The snow was pretty good too. @EnvAgencyYNE @CoalAuthority #Nenthead #reducepollution #loveyourtyne https://t.co/0DO2s380La

A landscape-scale project to address the impact of climate change and safeguard a much-loved amenity by returning a Devon estuary and flood plain to a more natural condition, has been given unanimous approval by East Devon District Council planning committee. [1/4] https://t.co/TDIZ5scjuD

tweets.text:
Did you know? Tanks must have an #oil care sticker to remind you how to look after your oil and what to do if you have a spill. 

You can order a sticker at: https://t.co/uAbbglBhi4

The site also provides guidance on looking after your tank, including how to deal with spills.

If you are passionate about plastic pollution and have time to learn at the moment @LimnoPlast  are running some really excellent webinars on a number of #plasticpollution  topics in freshwater. Register for freeüêüüòÉ @EnvAgencyAnglia @EnvAgency @Refill @CambridgeRefill @huntsdc https://t.co/nwFNyX4hcb

For anyone who isn‚Äôt yet aware...Trout in the Town is up & running on Douglas Catchment and this is the Twitter Feed. Take a follow! @lawt_d @MarkHChampion @WiganCouncil @EnvAgencyNW @RibbleTrust @GroundworkCLM @WLBC_Rangers @theriverstrust A few of our core partners are leading! https://t.co/xwdf8BWBaw

tweets.text:
We attended a pollution near #Grantham, oil from a domestic oil tank leaked into a watercourse. 

Domestic oil tanks need to be maintained and inspected regularly by a qualified person. 

If you suspect your tank is leaking report it to 0800 807060.  https://t.co/2wcZeNOv4J https://t.co/KKthFM5yVw
Great work with our partners @CheshPolRural to crack down on #WasteCrime. https://t.co/mOzXcNtRyo

Should leaving public roads in this state when another night of sub-zero temps forecast be considered criminal negligence? Gross negligence? Any suggestions for good reason for working the field today? #stewardsoftheland @orfc @SoilAssociation @HighwaysEngland @DCPoliceTraffic https://t.co/3tucSPjvUL
@MsStockford @OwenPaterson @FarmersWeekly @EnvAgency Yes, how foolish of me to follow expert guidance rather than come up with my own theories

Making your property resilient to flooding could be more simple than you think. If you've never heard of property flood resilience measures or want to learn more about them, this short animation explains all: https://t.co/iEdyJn19sY

@PaulBurrowsy @ADA_updates @EnvAgencyAnglia @johncurtinEA @MoretonBack1 @FascinatingFens @WaterREast @MLCnavigation @Elygroupofidbs @fensbiosphere Have you seen Jon Tracey's drone video? https://t.co/qXO3XRpdAw

tweets.text: @ChrisNorep @MonicaHone @EnvAgencyAnglia @AnglianWater Thanks Chris. It was first seen before the very heavy rain, but very evident in this flooding. Hence why there is oil in the woods and the lake as well as along the river. Great ideas for the EA /UEA to follow up.

Ground investigations started this week. Construction expected to start mid 2021. https://t.co/jX6HJRhJcD

@Sue4AudleyWard @SoTCityCouncil @EnvAgencyMids @NewsNBC Hi Sue, if you'd like to know more or have any particular queries please send us a DM and we'll get back to you as soon as poss. Thanks!

The @EnvAgency  Target for inspecting sewage works in Thames region in 2017 was on average once every EIGHT YEARS. Target 33 achieved 17. Still the leadership cut the monitoring staff. Wondering where it all went wrong? @EmmaHowardBoyd
@WildStoke @EnvAgencyMids @SoTCityCouncil @NewsNBC Is there any update on the fowlea brook diversion scheme

We're improving nine routes in the borough to strengthen links between open spaces, encourage wildlife to flourish and help people to walk, cycle and connect with nature across the borough - https://t.co/bvPn6R3L8t https://t.co/wSJ7MYu6Tm

@iainrbarreco @MonicaHone @EnvAgencyAnglia @AnglianWater Or surface flooding lifts oil sitting in the balancing tank or elsewhere in an interceptor?
https://t.co/tgS4XsajFX

@iainrbarreco @MonicaHone @EnvAgencyAnglia @AnglianWater Sorry- read what EA said about this being from surface water drain. Heavy rainfall event over Christmas/New Year plus poorly maintained road/car park interceptor (perhaps due to building being unused due to COVID19) lifts oil mass into balancing tank in surface water system?
